name: Saylani Welfare Trust Usa
mission: Saylani Welfare International Trust has been working since 1999 to improve the conditions of the less privileged, helpless, and handicapped individuals ...
zakatClaimEvidence: The Saylani Welfare Trust USA donation page lists "Sadqah & Zakat" as a donation option. Additionally, their FAQ section includes the question, "Can I pay my zakat donation or only sadqa (non-zakat) donaitons are accepted?" While a specific project (IT Park) explicitly states that zakat will not be accepted for it, this implies that zakat is accepted for other eligible projects. (Source: https://www.saylaniwelfare.com/donate)

dimension_explanations.alignment: Saylani Welfare Trust USA is highly aligned with humanitarian causes and Muslim donor requirements, as it is Zakat-eligible and accepts various forms of Islamic giving [3]. Its long-standing track record since 1999 provides a strong foundation for donor trust [3].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates high directness in its service delivery, focusing on immediate needs like hunger and healthcare [1]. With a program expense ratio of 98.8%, nearly all of its $1,727,397 in total revenue goes directly to these services rather than overhead [1][2].

baseline_narrative.summary: Established as part of a mission dating back to 1999, Saylani Welfare Trust USA focuses on improving conditions for the less privileged through medical services and daily food programs like Saylani Dastarkhwan [1][3]. ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who prioritize maximum financial efficiency and want their Zakat to directly fund food and medical aid in Pakistan with zero overhead leakage.

Focus on immediate humanitarian needs like hunger and healthcare
Prefer supporting established Pakistani social welfare missions

Gifts support a high-volume, direct-delivery model

impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: The charity operates on the logic that providing immediate food, health, and vocational training removes barriers to survival and economic mobility.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that high-volume feeding and medical programs are resulting in long-term poverty reduction.

strengths.detail: The charity directs <cite id="1">100.0% of its expenses to programs</cite>, far exceeding the <cite id="2">peer program ratio median of 89.6%</cite>.
The organization spends <cite id="2">$0.00 to raise every $1</cite> in contributions, maximizing the impact of donor funds.
Saylani maintains a <cite id="2">90.5/100 rating from Charity Navigator</cite> and has earned a Gold Seal of Transparency from Candid.

strengths_deep_dive: Saylani Welfare Trust USA demonstrates a remarkable commitment to direct service delivery, as evidenced by its <cite id="1">$1,727,397 in program service revenue</cite> being fully utilized for humanitarian aid. Their operational model is highly cost-effective, achieving an estimated <cite id="2">cost of $9.60 per beneficiary</cite>, which is considered exceptional for the global education and relief sector. This efficiency is supported by a <cite id="2">perfect 100 score in Culture & Community</cite> from Charity Navigator, indicating strong organizational health and alignment with its mission to serve the handicapped and helpless individuals in Pakistan.
rich_narrative.summary: Saylani Welfare Trust USA is a humanitarian organization dedicated to alleviating poverty and providing essential services to the less privileged in Pakistan. Operating as part of a mission that dates back to 1999, the charity focuses on critical areas such as food security, healthcare, and education. The organization reported <cite id="1">$1,727,397 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 tax year, demonstrating significant growth with a <cite id="4">3-year revenue CAGR of 1263.3%</cite>. Saylani is distinguished by its lean operational model, maintaining an <cite id="2">exceptional program expense ratio of 98.8%</cite>, ensuring that every dollar donated is directed toward its core missions. Key initiatives include the <cite id="3">Saylani Dastarkhwan</cite>, which provides daily meals to thousands, alongside specialized medical services and <cite id="3">IT education programs</cite> designed to empower youth. The charity holds a <cite id="2">90.5/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>, reflecting strong performance in accountability and transparency. Furthermore, the organization is <cite id="3">verified as Zakat-eligible</cite>, specifically serving the asnaf categories of <cite id="3">fuqara (the poor) and masakin (the needy)</cite>.
